attributes.action: Ensure that recipients of Sickness Benefit are no worse off than those on other benefits.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is not uncommon for recipients of Sickness Benefit who have no savings and no other income to find they are entitled only to partial Council Tax Benefit, no concessions on transport or admissions to local facilities, reductions in dental and optical costs rather than full help, and no assistance with prescription costs at all. They don’t qualify for Income Support, because apparently Sickness Benefit is ‘enough to live on’, so they don’t get access to all the other things that Income Support or Jobseeker claimants do.

It’s hard enough living with long-term illness, without making sick people have to cut back on food in order to get the medication they need or have a tooth abscess treated. Sick people need just as much benefit as the unemployed, if not more in order to compensate for what they can’t do because of illness. Immediate action should be taken to ensure that recipients of Sickness Benefit are no poorer than anyone else on benefits.
